answers.answer: He should go to the vet.  He could simply have a bladder infection that could be treated very easily.  He might also have bladder stones.Diabetes and kidney disease can also present this way.So you see he will need to go to the vet right away.  Hopefully, it will be a simple bladder infection.  Let us know what happens!

If he is drinking alot there ia about a 90% chance that it is a bladder infection. Does the unrine have a strong smell to it?It could also be stones too like peekawho stated but in that case he will be going out often and you will notice that he will try to go and very little urine will come out at times.Take a sample with you to the Vet so they can do a quick Culture and get him on an antibiotic.Let us know how you make out. Hopefully that is all it is.
well I did take Ernie to the vet.She said the tests show Diabetes.....So wish us luck Y';all.Thanks so much for the answers.

My first thought when you said that he was drinking a lot of water was that he had become diabetic.  I'm glad you took him to the vet when you did.Animals can lead amazingly normal lives with diabetes, you just have to be diligent in whatever method you and your vet choose to control it, be it diet or medication.Good luck to you and your doggie.  Please stay around and keep us updated as to how you guys are doing with his treatment.  :)Ghilly

I'm sorry to hear that it is Diabetes but you seem to have caught it early. Hopefully medication and diet will do it for him.The fact that you said he was acting normal in all other ways steered me away from Diabetes as they usually become lethargic with the disease. When they have the bladder infection they are usually normal other than the changes in urination.I wish you both well with treatment and let us know what the Vet decides treatment for his condition is going to be.Dino

Thank you all so much for the replies and for caring.Ernie is really so sweet-we would do anything to help him..The vet has him on low doses-2x a day- of Vesalin(insulin) he seems to be doing ok with it-so far...He also has a gall bladder problem which we are giving him anti-biotics.Doc seemed to think this is an ongoing med-Gall Bladder is very sludgy.Hopefully we can control this problem too.My hubby was a Navy Medic and is very comfortable with the injections-I am going to wait till we get the doseage correct before I try...(OMG!) I think I can handle this.I will let y'all know what happens....So far his appitite is good,he is very playful and the drinking has slowed down.......No more wetting inside-Thank God.Thank you all again.....Erniesmom

That is great news! I think everything is going to work out well and these health issues were caught early and your dog is responding to treatment well right away.Don't be a stranger and keep posting to let us know how things are going.Be well.Dino

question: My 6yr old male schnauzer--who is very house trained.....Suddenly last week  I awoke to the sound of him wetting on the floor,He had that look like he didnt know what he was doing..The next night I heard him walking and I woke and got him out right away.....Then the next night he was on the bed with me..He laid right next to me and was pushing up agaisnt me.So I moved and he did it again..So I moved again.Then he jumped down from the bed and I sort of felt where he was.The bed was wet and so was my top.He has never done anything like this before...I noticed he has been drinking a lot of water at night.He is eating and playing just as usual.I see no difference ini him except this wetting problem.He is just tje sweetest dog and I know its not a spite thing with him.He really had a look on his litle face as though he was lost. I need help.Thanks
